content.description: Stand start with underclings underneath the large plate like feature and good feet below you. Pull on and bump up from the underclings to sidepulls on either sid of the plate feature, adjust your feet nad then move up to good edges in the quartz like portion of the rock. from here you should be able to reach good holds at the lip of the boulder and topout just to the right of the start of the climb.
content.location: Right side of the Backwoods Bloc, to the right side of the face you would see if hiking into this boulder from the Pond Scum Boulder, it is easily visible from the trail.

content.description: Sit start with left hand in slot and right hand on higher edge in the overhang, good feet to the left. Pull on and bump right hand up into a small slot and then get high feet and move out left into the crack in the middle of the boulder. Traverse along crimps in the crack, with good feet below you, out to the left arete, topout at the arete on jugs at the top of the crack.
content.protection: 2-3 pads, the climbs traverses a good bit.
content.location: Starting at the nose of the Backwoods Bloc and traversing left along the obvious crack line away from the trail.

content.description: Stand start on underclings just to the right of the tree at the left arete of this side of the Backwoods Bloc. With good feet below you pull on and make a long reach up to the lip to grab a sloper/vertical crimp. Match the lip with the right and then fight your way over the bulge using a sloping crimp on the left side and a wide pinch/sloper on the right near the top of the crack.  Topout is definitely the crux and it's not over 'till it's over.
content.location: Right side of the Backwoods Bloc, to the right of the Backwoods Nose, this would be one of the first problems you would see if hiking into this boulder from the Pond Scum Boulder, it is easily visible from the trail.

content.description: Stand start on underclings at the base of the (currently) dirty crack, using good feet below the crack pull onto the wall and make a reach up and left into the crack, adjust feet and then come up right hand into a sidepull/undercling; from here you should be able to reach up to the lip where there is a sloped pinch along the lip above and to the right of the crack. match this, get your feet in a good position and then mantle up just to the right of the crack.
content.location: Right side of the Backwoods Bloc, to the right of the Backwoods Nose, this would be one of the first problems you would see if hiking into this boulder from the Pond Scum Boulder, The crack this line follows is easily visible from the trail.

content.description: Sit start on the raised rock, reach up to a high right hand edge and left hand on the arete. Pull on with small feet at the base of the arete and bump right hand up to a positive edge, adjust the feet, bump left up the arete and move right up to the jugs at the top of the arete; topout straight up as for Tar and Tin.
content.location: Left most problem on the boulder if looking at it from the trail. It starts sitting on a raised rock, above the end of Tar and Tin.

content.description: Start as for Tar and Tin with left hand in slot and right hand on higher edge in the overhang and good feet to the left. Pull on and bump right hand up into a small slot, get the first hold out left in the crack; but, then instead of traversing the crack left, grab a hold on the right side of the arete right near an obvious chockstone and bump your left hand up to the lip of the boulder directly above the start. From here you can match the lip and topout straight up using a variety of sloped crimps on the lip getting you back to a sidepull jug and an easy mantle.
content.location: Startying right at the base of the arete on the Backwoods Bloc, the start of this line is the one closest to the trail on this boulder.

content.description: Sit start with left hand on a sloping side pull and a right hand in a small vertical crack. pull on and make a move up and right to a good edge above the crack. Adjust your feet and continue straight up through a variety of good edges in the mossy section in the middle of the face. Topout straight up above the start on good edges with your choice of large feet.
content.location: Right most climb on the Backwoods Bloc, visible from the trail when walking in from the Pond Scum boulder on the far right arete.

content.description: 12/13' tall boulder with a number of vert & horizontal crack seams. The right side of the boulder (as approaching it from the trail) is littered with easier holds. The overhanging face closer to the Backwoods slab seems to have the potential for a few moderates.
